adjective.description: Of or relating to combustion or combustibility; combustible.

origin: Early 19th century; earliest use found in Henry John Todd (d. 1845), Church of England clergyman and literary scholar. From ancient Greek ἔμπυρος burnt (from ἐμ-, variant (before a labial) of ἐν- + πῦρ fire: see pyro-) + -ical.
